trans-unit.source: Represents the metrics used to lay out a character in a device font.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics> object is constructed using the default metric values.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics"></xref> class by specifying the metrics as a string.
The `metrics` parameter is a comma-delimited string that specifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics> properties in the following order:
The first two properties, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, are required.
However, the other five properties are optional, and will default to zero if not specified.

For example, if you specify the string value of "0.75,0.75,,0.1" for the `metrics` parameter, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A> properties are set—the unspecified properties are set to zero.
A comma-delimited <xref href="System.String"></xref> value that represents the metrics for the character.
Gets the baseline value for the character.
The return value represents the vertical offset from the bottom of the black box to the baseline.
A positive value indicates the baseline is above the bottom of the black box, while a negative value indicates the baseline is below the bottom of the black box.
A value of type <xref href="System.Double"></xref> representing the baseline.
Gets the height of the black box for the character.
A value of type <xref href="System.Double"></xref> representing the black box height.
Gets the width of the black box for the character.
A value of type <xref href="System.Double"></xref> representing the black box width.
Gets the recommended white space below the black box.
A negative value indicates an overhang.

The vertical advance for the character is the sum of the property values <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.TopSideBearing%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BottomSideBearing%2A>.
The vertical advance cannot be less than zero.
A value of type <xref href="System.Double"></xref>.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics"></xref> object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics"></xref> object.
Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics> objects are equal if the following properties are equal:
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics"></xref> object to compare to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics"></xref> object.
`true` if the objects are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Creates a hash code from the metric values of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics"></xref> object.
A value of type <xref href="System.Int32"></xref>.
Gets the recommended white space to the left of the black box.
A negative value indicates an overhang.
The horizontal advance for the character is

the sum of the property values <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.RightSideBearing%2A>.
The horizontal advance cannot be less than zero.
A value of type <xref href="System.Double"></xref>.
Gets or sets a comma-delimited string representing metric values.
The <xref:System.String> value is a comma-delimited string that specifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics> properties in the following order:
The first two properties, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, are required.
However, the other five properties are optional, and will default to zero if not specified.

For example, if you specify the string value of "`0.75,0.75,,0.1`" for the `metrics` parameter, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A> properties are set—the unspecified properties are set to zero.
A value of type <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
Gets the recommended white space to the right of the black box.
A negative value indicates an overhang.
The horizontal advance for the character is

the sum of the property values <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.RightSideBearing%2A>.
The horizontal advance cannot be less than zero.
A value of type <xref href="System.Double"></xref>.
Gets the recommended white space above the black box.
Recommended white space above the black box.

The vertical advance for the character is the sum of the property values <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.TopSideBearing%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BottomSideBearing%2A>.
The vertical advance cannot be less than zero.
A value of type <xref href="System.Double"></xref>.
